page.title: 05HISTORIC HOUSE,CARSHALTON.
page.content: Now St. Philomena's School, this fine example of classical architecture dates from l7l5 when Sir John Fellowes bought the estate. The house has all the external features of the classical style in England, large sashed windows symmetrically arranged,a flat roof, a cornice and entrance doors complete with pediments, porticoes and steps. The interior has been converted to accommodate class rooms, music department and sixth form library and common rooms. However, a number of interesting features remain from the original interior and include a fine staircase, panelled library, a painted room, an oak panelled reception room and a blue parlour beautifully restored in the Adam style. Visits are made only by appointment in the school holidays by arrangement with the Sister Superior.
